Note: go here for the latest update!
[url=http://forums.nexusmods.com/index.php?/topic/2193584-hardcore-rpg-rule-system-for-skyrim/]http://forums.nexusm...tem-for-skyrim/[/url]

Did you play adventure games where you had to roll dice to determine your fate? hanging on to the slender thread of hope! (this is kindda like when playing on the PS3, and you hit the Triangle, when you really meant to hit the Square button, but were actually thinking how nice it would be if you pushed the circle button ... or maybe it's when the cat pisses on your XBox and then it lights on fire and holy smokes! :P)

Well, i am happy to say this is not nearly as dire as all that, Skyrim's faithful dragons will see to your demise,
This system only aims to perhaps encumber you a bit more in your travels, adding an extra stone to carry say, but no Venomous traps to kill you at the fail of a roll

All you need is a six-sided dice to get you started (and preferably a dice cup)
Roll the dice when the 'Events' occur below, and check for its results,
High numbers yield better results,
in some cases the dice numbers are used individually, but all is explained in each 'Event',

There are only five 'Events' to that act as triggers, in total, so as to keep it easy to remember

Why i did this:
Call me strange if you will, but there is a certain thrill factor behind rolling dice which has always allured me, and the higher the risks, the greater the rewards xD
i was the Dungeon Master for me and my friends D&D group, so i have read and used many sets of rules before. This is more based on the later adventure books, 'Fighting Fantasy' ring a bell?
These had really great and simple rules, yet they really packed a punch, and you felt them good!
Lol, i think you can download some of these in digital format now :)

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

-- Lvl up
1st Roll
(4-6) >> upgrade any skill tree you choose
(1-3) >> can only upgrade a lesser skill tree

2nd Roll
(4-6) >> choose between health, stamina or magic
(1-3) >> use one with lowest number

-- Leaving City
(4-6) >> you choose destination
(1-3) >> re-roll dice
this number is the direction to a city you must travel
pick the city furthest away
use your own discretion
1 - NW, 2 - N, 3 - NE, 4 - E, 5 -SE, 6 - SW

-- Selling Items (roll per trader)
(4-6) >> Trade as much as you desire
(1-3) >> Buy 1 item and/or Sell 1 item

-- Looting Corpses
(4-6) >> Loot as many corpses as you please
(1-3) >> Choose only one corpse to loot

-- Player Death
(4-6) >> you choose a weapon/armor to discard
(1-3) >> re-roll dice
this number is how many items you must discard
only weapons and armor can be discarded
and one weapon/armor must be a worn item

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Of course these variables can be suited to your needs, it can be easily extended to magic and thievery systems alike

Let me know what you think, your feedback is welcome :)

(Tip: only one dice is needed, but i recommend using two different color dice if you can. At times only one dice roll is need, at other two, but fact is that two dice just roll better together)
